summary: An email from a forensic psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center reporting an inmate's claim that his cellmate, Tartaglione, was told by guards that they would not file a report if he beat him. This is brought to attention in light of recent claims by inmate Epstein that his cellmate injured him.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate at Metropolitan Correctional Center who previously claimed his cellmate injured him. Referenced by his inmate number #76318-054.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Cellmate of the reporting inmate, identified by inmate number #78514-054. Allegedly told by guards they would not file a report if he beat the reporting inmate.

persons.name: Ms.
persons.context: Conducted an interview where Epstein's cellmate denied injuring him. Only referred to by title.

connections.description: Tartaglione is referenced as the cellmate of the inmate who reported the threat, and the context links to Epstein's previous claim about his own cellmate injuring him, suggesting a parallel concern about cellmate violence.

events.title: Report of Guard-Incited Violence Threat
events.description: An inmate reported to a forensic psychologist that his cellmate Tartaglione was told by guards that if he beat him, they would not file a report.

events.title: Psychologist's Report on Inmate Safety Concerns
events.description: A forensic psychologist emails superiors to report a new inmate claim of guard-incited violence, linking it to recent claims by inmate Epstein about being injured by his cellmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: An inmate claimed his cellmate, Tartaglione, was told by guards that they would not file a report if he beat him.
This report was made by a forensic psychologist in light of recent claims by inmate Epstein that his cellmate had injured him.
The document indicates ongoing concerns about inmate safety and potential guard misconduct at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The correspondence is marked as containing SENSITIVE information and is confidential.
